comments.article: Give Dracula a cigar.

comments.article:
A guess from the crew at Winter-is-coming.net:

Amy Joyce Hastings as Mel
How about Amy Joyce Hastings as Melisandre? She is in 'The Callback Queen" with Morgan Deare. And last year she auditioned for Doreah. She is also invovled with 22:22 Productions.
comments.subject: AJH as Melisandre?

comments.article: Is Morgan Deare playing Stannis Baratheon?

Us humble members of House Gatewatch, over at WiCnet, speculate that it is Amy Joyce Hastings for the part of the Red Woman, due to her many connections with the film "The CallBack Queen", 22:22 productions, and that she auditioned for Doreah for season 1.
comments.subject: Melisandre?

comments.article: i will be shocked if it's not this
comments.subject: Re: Melisandre?

comments.article: How did you come the conclusion it was Stannis. isnt he too old to play that part? Stannis is Roberts younger brother after all. Maybe Balon Greyjoy if I´m to guess.
comments.subject: Why Stannis?

comments.article:
It's the threes on the cover. Three children, trilogy, etc. The crown, the mention of betrayals, the flames behind the crown.
"his greatest challenge is admitting that betrayal exists ..."
It's just a guess, maybe not a good one.
I always forget that Stannis is younger than Robert. He's so rigid, he always seems older to me.
comments.subject: Re: Why Stannis?

comments.article:
Stannis Baratheon

William Hurt or Mark Strong. Must be a very well known actor.
comments.subject: Please

comments.article: I'm confused.  Is Prince of Chaos the title or the author?
This is what I deduced :Horatio Sanz will play Biter.

Additionally, some members of House Gatewatch over at Winter-is-coming.net feel that this may be a clue for MULTIPLE castings and put forth that Morgan Deare would make an excellent Hoster Tully - as having three children and the same initials as Houston, Texas, might show.

comments.article: I don't know who this is or what is going on, but I do want to know why there is a glaring typo in the first SENTENCE of the back cover copy. Ouch.
